stories.story_name: Refactor ProcureSight Site Tab Search Functionality
stories.acceptance_criteria: **GIVEN**: User is on the ProcureSight Site tab **WHEN**: User enters search terms and clicks search button **THEN**: Results are displayed using the new ProcureSight+ Module interface with procurement results and expanded filter set

stories.story_name: Enable Add to Collection and Save to Requirement Actions
stories.acceptance_criteria: **GIVEN**: User views procurement search results **WHEN**: User clicks 'Add to Collection' or 'Save to Requirement' action **THEN**: The procurement is saved to the selected collection or requirement with confirmation
**GIVEN**: User views search results **WHEN**: User clicks on a result card **THEN**: Procurement Summary displays with all data and links to Vendor Summary and Codes Summary
**GIVEN**: User is viewing procurement documents **WHEN**: User clicks on a document from search results **THEN**: Native AI Chat interface opens allowing user to chat with the document
**GIVEN**: User accesses Requirement Summary **WHEN**: User navigates to the insights section **THEN**: Tabs are reorganized as Research, Bookmarks, Search, Documents, and Best in Class

stories.story_name: Implement Search Tab in Requirement Summary
stories.acceptance_criteria: **GIVEN**: User is on the Search tab in Requirement Summary **WHEN**: User performs a search **THEN**: Global search interface displays with recent searches and procurement results with Save to Requirement action

stories.story_name: Create Bookmarks Tab for Saved Procurements
stories.acceptance_criteria: **GIVEN**: User has saved procurements to requirement **WHEN**: User clicks on Bookmarks tab **THEN**: All saved procurements are displayed with ability to view details and remove items
**GIVEN**: User accesses ProcureSight Collections **WHEN**: User views the collections grid **THEN**: Updated UX displays as per mockup specifications

stories.story_name: Implement Collection Summary with Three Tabs
stories.acceptance_criteria: **GIVEN**: User opens a collection **WHEN**: User views collection summary **THEN**: Three tabs are available: Bookmarks, Documents, and Insights with respective content
**GIVEN**: User has access to collections **WHEN**: User performs create, update, or view operations **THEN**: Collection operations complete successfully with appropriate feedback
